scrabble

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • scrabble.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board holds the the 15x15 grid of Square objects.

    The public interface does not allow explicit placing of tiles. You may only place tiles using the applyWordPlacement(scrabble.Player, scrabble.WordPlacement) method.

    Board has no custom toString method. It can be printed to console using the printBoard() method.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Initializes board, setting up empty grid with correct modifiers.

        public Board()

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets board to original state

      • setTile

        protected void setTile(BoardPos pos,
                       Tile tile)
        Puts a tile in the given location. This method only works for non-BLANK tiles, since we don't provide the letter.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position of destination square
        tile - The tile to place in square
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tile is Tile.BLANK

      • getLetterAt

        public char getLetterAt(BoardPos pos)
        Returns the letter at the given position on the board. Should not be called if hasTileAt(BoardPos) returns false
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to request the letter at.
        Returns:
        The letter at that position on the board
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no letter was present.

      • hasTileAt

        public boolean hasTileAt(BoardPos pos)
        Checks if a tile has been placed at given position on the board.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position in board to check
        Returns:
        true if square at given position is not empty, otherwise false

      • getModiferAt

        public scrabble.Square.Modifier getModiferAt(BoardPos pos)
        Gets the modifier for square at given position on the board.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position in board to get the modifier for
        Returns:
        the modifier at the given position

      • applyWordPlacement

        public void applyWordPlacement(Player player,
                               WordPlacement wordPlacement)
                        throws BadWordPlacementException
        Tries to apply a given WordPlacement move using player's tiles.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to take tiles from
        wordPlacement - specifies the letters and positions to place the tile at. BLANKs are automatically placed if necessary
        Throws:
        BadWordPlacementException - if wordPlacement would cause an invalid move

      • getNeededTiles

        public java.util.List<Tile> getNeededTiles(WordPlacement wordPlacement)
                                    throws BadWordPlacementException
        Gets tiles needed from Player's frame in order to fully apply wordPlacement Takes into account what is already on the board and returns a list of necessary tiles. These may not be exactly the tiles that are placed however. Since a tile can be exchanged for a BLANK if necessary.
        Parameters:
        wordPlacement - specifies what letter and where it is to be placed
        Returns:
        A non-empty list of tiles that have not already been placed.
        Throws:
        BadWordPlacementException - if a differing letter already exists in one of the destinations, or if no tiles need to be placed.

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Prints the board in stylised fashion. All squares are seperated using +, / and - characters.
